Pico Geyer wrote:

> I was just wondering what was the common practice on testing
> constructors.
> Should they be tested. If not why not?

The standard answer for all these kinds of question is: if it might 
break, then test it.

As for constructors in particular, how would you know the constructor 
was broken? If you get any interesting answers, such as something that 
isn't covered by another test you have written/intend to write, then 
write that test.
